ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course imparted the ability of applying various critical and philosophical theories in reading the performative aspects of dramatic texts.
Generally speaking, I have learned first that theater may be a great area for thinking, and developed (I hope) some questions and "skills" connected to reading\watching and interpreting it.
Deeper understanding about the history of theater from antiquity to modernity.
I got a good introduction to theatre and performance studies texts

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Mainly Strengths: The course offers an intellectual challenge and a great deal of interest. The plays we discussed reflected different historical developments in the perception of the theater itself and the theoretical texts we have read have broadened, accordingly, the concept of performance and its relevance to theater, language, gender, and identity politics.
Strengths: Impressive close readings that develop into broader questions; good discussions in class and welcoming, encouraging environment.
Interesting and engaging class. Enjoed every session!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I will strongly recommend the course because it provides a complex and interesting examination of the concept of performance and provides a glimpse into the history of the theater itself.
Yes! It was a very interesting and thought-provoking course.
One of my best classes this semester. Great discussions and overall learning experience
I would highly recommend this course to anyone. It was one of the best courses I have taken at Yale, interesting, insightful and thought-provoking.
